text: Bryan Maitland. Author, maintainer. Morgan Sparks. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Maitland B, Sparks M (2024). hatchR: Predict Fish Hatching Emergence Daily Temperature Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://bmait101.github.io/hatchR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {hatchR: Predict Fish Hatching and Emergence from Daily Temperature Data},   author = {Bryan Maitland and Morgan Sparks},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://bmait101.github.io/hatchR/}, }

title: Predict Fish Hatching and Emergence from Daily Temperature Data
text: DEVELOPMENT hatchR R package predicting fish developmental phenology using statistical models. intended bridge analytic gap taking statistical models developed hatchery settings (e.g., Beacham Murray 1990) applying real world temperature data sets using effective value framework developed Sparks et al. (2019).

title: Predict Fish Hatching and Emergence from Daily Temperature Data
text: can install development version hatchR GitHub :

title: Predict Fish Hatching and Emergence from Daily Temperature Data
text: DEVELOPMENT

title: Predict Fish Hatching and Emergence from Daily Temperature Data
text: hatchR suggests following R Packages: ggplot2 - vignette vizualizations. lubridate - date-time manipulation. knitr: vignette building. rmarkdown: vignette building. testthat: unit testing.

what: Fit B&M model 2 to new data — fit_model
title: Fit B&M model 2 to new data — fit_model
text: Generate custom parameterized models predicting hatching emergence phenology

title: Fit B&M model 2 to new data — fit_model
Fit B&M model 2 to new data — fit_model
text: df Data.frame new data temp Column temperature measurement days Column day temperature measurement

title: Fit B&M model 2 to new data — fit_model
text: List model object, coefficients, model expression, plot

title: Fit B&M model 2 to new data — fit_model
text: hatchR also includes functionality generate custom parameterized models predicting hatching emergence phenology. Importantly, custom parameterization relies model format developed model 2 Beacham Murray (1990), chose overall simplicity negligible loss accuracy. See Beacham Murray (1990) Sparks et al. (2019) specific discussion regarding model 2 development effective value approach.

title: Fit B&M model 2 to new data — fit_model
code: library(hatchR) # vector of temperatures temperature <- c(2,5,8,11,14) # vector of days to hatch days_to_hatch <- c(194,87,54,35,28) quinn_bt_hatch <- tibble::tibble(temperature, days_to_hatch) bt_hatch_mod <- fit_model(df = quinn_bt_hatch, temp = temperature, days = days_to_hatch) #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf

what: hatchR: Predict Fish Hatching and Emergence from Daily Temperature Data — hatchR-package
title: hatchR: Predict Fish Hatching and Emergence from Daily Temperature Data — hatchR-package
text: hatchR intended bridge analytic gap taking statistical models developed hatchery settings (e.g., Beacham Murray 1990) applying real world temperature data sets using effective value framework developed Sparks et al. (2019).

title: hatchR: Predict Fish Hatching and Emergence from Daily Temperature Data — hatchR-package
text: Maintainer: Bryan Maitland bryan.maitland@usda.gov (ORCID) Authors: Morgan Sparks morgan.sparks@usda.gov

what: Select a development model structure — model_select
title: Select a development model structure — model_select
text: function calls model table parameterizations different species different studies built . Refer table (model_table) using function find inputs different function arguments. pulls model format string parses usable hatchR model.

title: Select a development model structure — model_select
Select a development model structure — model_select
text: author Source model. species Species common name. model Model number type Beacham Murray (1990). dev.type Phenology type (e.g., "hatch" "emerge").

title: Select a development model structure — model_select
text: model function.

title: Select a development model structure — model_select
code: library(hatchR) # access the parameterization for sockeye hatching using # model #2 from Beacham and Murray (1990) sockeye_hatch_mod <- model_select(   author = "Beacham and Murray 1990",   species = "sockeye",   model = 2,   dev.type = "hatch" ) # print sockeye_hatch_mod #> expression(1/exp(6.727 - log(x + 2.394)))

what: Plot imported data to check temperature values — plot_check_temp
title: Plot imported data to check temperature values — plot_check_temp
text: plot_check_temp function used plot imported data check temperature values. function takes data frame dates temperature values, plots temperature values time. function also allows users specify minimum maximum temperature values plotted.

title: Plot imported data to check temperature values — plot_check_temp
Plot imported data to check temperature values — plot_check_temp
text: data data.frame dates temperature dates date column temperature temperature column temp_min min temp plot temp_max max temp plot

title: Plot imported data to check temperature values — plot_check_temp
text: object class "gg" "ggplot" can printed console saved image.

title: Plot imported data to check temperature values — plot_check_temp
code: library(hatchR) plot_check_temp(   data = crooked_river,   dates = date,   temperature = temp_c )

text: plot object output predict_phenology style different plot types: , ef_cumsum, ef_daily labels true false, used turn information top plots

title: Plot phenology — plot_phenology
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot phenology — plot_phenology
code: library(hatchR) #plot_phenology(WI_hatch, style = "ef_cumsum") # shows a plot with just the ef cumulative sum values #plot_phenology(WI_hatch, style = "ef_daily") # shows a plot with just the ef daily values #plot_phenology(WI_hatch, labels = FALSE) # turns off the labeling for a cleaner figure
